overview: In June 2015, Erwann Babin, video artist, bought a field. He begins to shoot a film there, planting his camera there as one plants an agricultural tool in the middle of a meadow. He will stay there for eighteen months, giving free rein to his creativity like in an open-air artist's studio. The resulting film-essay mixes natural browsing, burlesque experimentation and artistic fantasies.
title: Parcelle 808
